alert.note: Alert for Coastal Duval; Coastal Nassau (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 13 at 8:10AM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Nassau and northeastern Duval Counties through 900 AM EDT... At 809 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm capable of producing a waterspout over the Atlantic Ocean 12 miles east of Jacksonville Beach, or 13 miles east of Ponte Vedra Beach, moving northwest at 20 mph. HAZARD...Waterspouts and winds around 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Waterspouts can easily overturn boats and create locally hazardous waters. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Fernandina Beach, Jacksonville Beach, Atlantic Beach, Yulee, Neptune Beach, Mayport, Talbot Island, Craig Field, San Pablo and Amelia City. WATERSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
